InButtonV2.name: InButtonV2
InButtonV2.title: In Button

metadata.description: A versatile button component with multiple variants and states. Supports solid, ghost, and text styling with various color themes.

accessibility.notes: Supports aria-label, proper button semantics, keyboard focus management

performance.notes: Lazy loads icon components, minimal re-renders

examples.title: Basic Button
examples.code:
<template>
  <InButtonV2
    id="submit-btn"
    styling="solid"
    type="primary"
    size="default"
    label-text="Submit"
    @click="handleSubmit" />
</template>

<script>
import { InButtonV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InButtonV2 },
  methods: {
    handleSubmit() {
      console.log('Form submitted');
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Button with Icon and Loading State
examples.description: Button with left icon and loading indicator
examples.code:
<template>
  <InButtonV2
    id="save-btn"
    styling="solid"
    type="primary"
    left-icon="save"
    icon-size="24"
    label-text="Save Changes"
    :loading-status="isSaving"
    :disabled-status="isSaving"
    @click="handleSave" />
</template>

<script>
import { InButtonV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InButtonV2 },
  data() {
    return {
      isSaving: false
    };
  },
  methods: {
    async handleSave() {
      this.isSaving = true;
      try {
        await this.saveData();
        alert('Saved!');
      } finally {
        this.isSaving = false;
      }
    },
    async saveData() {
      return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2000));
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Button Group with Dropdown
examples.code:
<template>
  <InButtonV2
    id="export-btn"
    styling="ghost"
    type="primary"
    left-icon="export"
    label-text="Export"
    :button-group-options="exportOptions"
    @click="handleExport" />
</template>

<script>
import { InButtonV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InButtonV2 },
  data() {
    return {
      exportOptions: [
        { label: 'Export as CSV', value: 'csv', icon: 'file-csv' },
        { label: 'Export as Excel', value: 'xlsx', icon: 'file-excel' },
        { label: 'Export as PDF', value: 'pdf', icon: 'file-pdf' }
      ]
    };
  },
  methods: {
    handleExport(payload) {
      if (payload?.value) {
        console.log('Exporting as:', payload.value);
        this.performExport(payload.value);
      }
    },
    performExport(format) {
      // Export logic
    }
  }
};
</script>

InCheckBoxV2.name: InCheckBoxV2
InCheckBoxV2.title: In Check Box

metadata.description: Checkbox component with indeterminate state and size variants

InCheckBoxV2.typeDefs:
import { DefineComponent } from 'vue';

/**
 * Validation state variants for the checkbox.
 */
export type CheckboxState = 'default' | 'danger' | 'warning';

/**
 * Checkbox option for group mode.
 */
export interface CheckboxOption {
  /**
   * Display text for the checkbox option.
   */
  text: string;

  /**
   * Unique value for the checkbox option.
   */
  value: string | number;

  /**
   * Whether this option is checked by default.
   * @default false
   */
  checked?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Skeleton loader sizing configuration.
 */
export interface SkeletonSizing {
  /**
   * Skeleton width in pixels.
   */
  width: number;

  /**
   * Skeleton height in pixels.
   */
  height: number;
}

/**
 * InCheckBoxV2 component props.
 */
export interface InCheckBoxV2Props {
  /**
   * Unique identifier for the checkbox element.
   * Used for DOM manipulation, testing, and label association.
   *
   * @required
   * @example id="terms-checkbox"
   * @example id="subscribe-newsletter"
   */
  id: string;

  /**
   * Name attribute for the checkbox input.
   * Used in form submissions.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example name="terms"
   * @example :name="123"
   */
  name?: string | number;

  /**
   * Label text displayed next to the checkbox.
   * Supports HTML content when preventXss is false.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example label-text="I accept the terms and conditions"
   * @example label-text="Enable notifications"
   */
  labelText?: string;

  /**
   * Additional description text displayed below the label.
   * Provides more context about the checkbox option.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example description-text="Receive updates about new features"
   */
  descriptionText?: string;

  /**
   * Validation or state message text.
   * Typically used for error or warning messages.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example state-message="This field is required"
   * @example state-message="Please review the terms"
   */
  stateMessage?: string;

  /**
   * Enables tooltip display on the label.
   * Tooltip content comes from tooltipText prop.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :tooltip-status="true"
   */
  tooltipStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Shows the description text below the label.
   * Must be true for descriptionText to be visible.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :description-status="true"
   */
  descriptionStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Controls visibility of the label text.
   * When false, only the checkbox input is shown.
   *
   * @default true
   * @example :label-status="false"
   */
  labelStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Makes the label text bold.
   * Useful for emphasizing important checkboxes.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :bold-label="true"
   */
  boldLabel?: boolean;

  /**
   * Tooltip content text.
   * Only shown when tooltipStatus is true.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example tooltip-text="Additional information about this option"
   */
  tooltipText?: string;

  /**
   * Shows skeleton loading placeholder instead of checkbox.
   * Used during initial page load.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :skeleton-status="isLoading"
   */
  skeletonStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Dimensions for the skeleton loader.
   * Only used when skeletonStatus is true.
   *
   * @default { width: 70, height: 24 }
   * @example :skeleton-sizing="{ width: 120, height: 32 }"
   */
  skeletonSizing?: SkeletonSizing;

  /**
   * Shows indeterminate state (dash icon).
   * Used for "select all" functionality when some items are selected.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :indeterminate="someSelected && !allSelected"
   */
  indeterminate?: boolean;

  /**
   * Controls the checked state of the checkbox.
   * Use with v-model for two-way binding.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :checked="isAccepted"
   * @example v-model="termsAccepted"
   */
  checked?: boolean;

  /**
   * Disables the checkbox, preventing user interaction.
   * Checkbox appears greyed out and cannot be toggled.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :disabled-status="!canModify"
   */
  disabledStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Array of checkbox options for group mode.
   * When provided, renders multiple checkboxes in a group.
   *
   * @default []
   * @example
   * :options="[
   *   { text: 'Option 1', value: 'opt1', checked: true },
   *   { text: 'Option 2', value: 'opt2', checked: false }
   * ]"
   */
  options?: CheckboxOption[];

  /**
   * Validation state of the checkbox.
   * Affects border color and state message styling.
   *
   * @default 'default'
   * @example state="danger" // Red border for errors
   * @example state="warning" // Yellow border for warnings
   */
  state?: CheckboxState;
}

/**
 * Click event payload for single checkbox.
 */
export type SingleCheckboxClickPayload = boolean;

/**
 * Click event payload for checkbox group.
 */
export type CheckboxGroupClickPayload = Array<string | number>;

/**
 * Event handler types for InCheckBoxV2.
 */
export interface InCheckBoxV2EventHandlers {
  /**
   * Handler for click event.
   * For single checkbox, payload is boolean (checked state).
   * For checkbox groups, payload is array of selected values.
   *
   * @param payload - Boolean for single checkbox, array for checkbox group
   * @example
   * // Single checkbox
   * const handleClick = (checked: boolean) => {
   *   console.log('Checkbox is now:', checked);
   * }
   *
   * @example
   * // Checkbox group
   * const handleClick = (selected: Array<string | number>) => {
   *   console.log('Selected values:', selected);
   * }
   */
  onClick?: (payload: SingleCheckboxClickPayload | CheckboxGroupClickPayload) => void;
}

/**
 * InCheckBoxV2 Component
 *
 * Flexible checkbox component supporting single checkboxes, checkbox groups,
 * indeterminate state, validation states, and skeleton loading.
 *
 * @example
 * // Basic single checkbox
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="terms"
 *   name="terms"
 *   label-text="I accept the terms"
 *   :checked="accepted"
 *   @click="accepted = $event"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With description
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="notifications"
 *   label-text="Enable notifications"
 *   description-text="Get email updates"
 *   :description-status="true"
 *   :checked="notificationsEnabled"
 *   @click="notificationsEnabled = $event"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // Indeterminate state
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="select-all"
 *   label-text="Select all"
 *   :checked="allSelected"
 *   :indeterminate="someSelected"
 *   @click="toggleAll"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // Checkbox group
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="interests"
 *   label-text="Select your interests"
 *   :options="[
 *     { text: 'Technology', value: 'tech', checked: true },
 *     { text: 'Design', value: 'design', checked: false }
 *   ]"
 *   @click="handleGroupSelection"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With validation
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="required"
 *   label-text="Required field"
 *   state="danger"
 *   state-message="You must accept this"
 *   :checked="value"
 *   @click="value = $event"
 * />
 */
declare const InCheckBoxV2: DefineComponent<InCheckBoxV2Props>;

export default InCheckBoxV2;

examples.title: Basic Checkbox Group with v-model
examples.description: Common use case: multiple selection checkbox group

examples.title: Checkbox Group with Validation
examples.description: Form with required checkbox and validation
examples.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const agreements = ref([]);
const options = [
  { id: 'terms', label: 'I agree to Terms of Service *', value: 'terms' },
  { id: 'privacy', label: 'I agree to Privacy Policy *', value: 'privacy' },
  { id: 'marketing', label: 'I want to receive marketing emails', value: 'marketing' }
];

const isValid = computed(() => 
  agreements.value.includes('terms') && 
  agreements.value.includes('privacy')
);

const handleSubmit = () => {
  if (!isValid.value) {
    alert('Please accept required agreements');
    return;
  }
  // Submit form
};
</script>

<template>
  <form @submit.prevent="handleSubmit">
    <InCheckBoxV2 
      v-model="agreements"
      :options="options"
    />
    <button :disabled="!isValid">Submit</button>
  </form>
</template>

examples.title: Conditional Disabled Options
examples.description: Dynamically disable options based on user tier
examples.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const userTier = ref('free'); // 'free', 'pro', 'enterprise'
const selectedFeatures = ref([]);

const featureOptions = computed(() => [
  { 
    id: 'basic', 
    label: 'Basic Features', 
    value: 'basic',
    disabled: false 
  },
  { 
    id: 'advanced', 
    label: 'Advanced Analytics (Pro+)', 
    value: 'advanced',
    disabled: userTier.value === 'free'
  },
  { 
    id: 'enterprise', 
    label: 'Enterprise Support (Enterprise Only)', 
    value: 'enterprise',
    disabled: userTier.value !== 'enterprise'
  }
]);
</script>

<template>
  <InCheckBoxV2 
    v-model="selectedFeatures"
    :options="featureOptions"
  />
</template>

commonMistakes.title: Using simple string array for options
commonMistakes.description: options prop requires array of objects, not strings
commonMistakes.correct: :options="[{ id: 'opt1', label: 'Option 1', value: 'value1' }, { id: 'opt2', label: 'Option 2', value: 'value2' }]"
commonMistakes.impact: Checkbox group won't render, component may throw errors

commonMistakes.title: Not using v-model for checkbox group
commonMistakes.description: Checkbox group needs v-model to track selected values
commonMistakes.impact: Selected values not tracked, state not synchronized

commonMistakes.title: Mixing single checkbox with options array
commonMistakes.description: Either use single checkbox mode OR checkbox group mode, not both
commonMistakes.impact: Unpredictable behavior, single checkbox props ignored when options provided

commonMistakes.title: Not providing accessible labels
commonMistakes.description: Each checkbox should have clear, descriptive label
commonMistakes.correct: :options="[{ id: 'terms', label: 'I agree to the Terms and Conditions', value: true }]"
commonMistakes.impact: Poor accessibility for screen readers, unclear purpose

commonMistakes.title: Not handling change events
commonMistakes.description: Checkbox selections should trigger appropriate actions
commonMistakes.impact: User selections don't trigger expected behavior or validation

valueFormat.objectShape: Array<{ id: string, label: string, value: any, disabled?: boolean, checked?: boolean }>
valueFormat.notes: When provided, renders multiple checkboxes in a group. Each option must have id and label. Useful for checkbox groups with multiple selections.

examples.value: [{ id: 'opt1', label: 'Option 1', value: 'value1' }, { id: 'opt2', label: 'Option 2', value: 'value2' }]
[{ id: 'opt1', label: 'Available', value: 'a', disabled: false }, { id: 'opt2', label: 'Unavailable', value: 'b', disabled: true }]
[{ id: 'opt1', label: 'Option 1', value: 'a', checked: true }, { id: 'opt2', label: 'Option 2', value: 'b', checked: false }]

valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ id: string; label: string; value: any; disabled?: boolean; checked?: boolean }>

commonMistakes.impact: Component won't render checkbox group properly
commonMistakes.fix: Use array of objects with id, label, and value properties

commonMistakes.impact: Cannot track which checkbox was selected, events don't work properly
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide unique 'id' for each option: { id: 'unique-id', label: '...', value: '...' }

commonMistakes.mistake: Using same id for multiple options
commonMistakes.impact: Checkbox state conflicts, unpredictable behavior
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure each option has a unique id within the group

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling v-model with checkbox group
commonMistakes.impact: Selected values not tracked, state not updated
commonMistakes.fix: Use v-model to bind selected values array: v-model="selectedOptions"

valueFormat.notes: Defines dimensions for skeleton loader placeholder. Only used when skeletonStatus is true.

examples.code: :skeleton-sizing="{ width: 20, height: 20 }"
:skeleton-sizing="{ width: 24, height: 24 }"

commonMistakes.impact: skeletonSizing has no effect if skeletonStatus is false
commonMistakes.fix: Enable skeleton: :skeleton-status="true" :skeleton-sizing="{ width: 20, height: 20 }"

change.when: Fires when any checkbox in the group is toggled

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting single value instead of array
commonMistakes.fix: Checkbox group always emits array of values: (values) => console.log(values)

update:modelValue.when: Fires when v-model needs updating (checkbox toggled)

bestPractices.title: Always Provide Unique IDs for Options
bestPractices.description: Use meaningful, unique identifiers for each checkbox option
bestPractices.benefit: Reliable state tracking, easier debugging, better event handling

bestPractices.title: Use v-model for Reactive State
bestPractices.description: Bind checkbox selections to reactive data for automatic state management
bestPractices.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';

const selectedPreferences = ref([]);
const preferences = [
  { id: 'pref1', label: 'Email', value: 'email' },
  { id: 'pref2', label: 'SMS', value: 'sms' }
];
</script>

<template>
  <InCheckBoxV2 
    v-model="selectedPreferences" 
    :options="preferences"
  />
</template>
bestPractices.benefit: Automatic state synchronization, reactive updates, easier form handling

bestPractices.title: Disable Individual Options When Needed
bestPractices.description: Use disabled property to prevent selection of unavailable options
bestPractices.benefit: Clear visual feedback, prevents invalid selections, better UX

bestPractices.title: Provide Clear, Descriptive Labels
bestPractices.description: Use full sentences or clear descriptions for checkbox labels
bestPractices.benefit: Better accessibility, clearer user intent, reduced confusion

bestPractices.title: Handle Change Events for Validation
bestPractices.description: Validate selections and provide feedback
bestPractices.code:
<script setup>
const handleChange = (selectedValues) => {
  if (!selectedValues.includes('terms')) {
    showError('You must accept the terms to continue');
  }
  validateForm();
};
</script>

<template>
  <InCheckBoxV2 
    v-model="selections" 
    :options="options"
    @change="handleChange"
  />
</template>
bestPractices.benefit: Real-time validation, immediate user feedback, better form UX

performanceNotes: Large checkbox groups (50+ options) may impact render performance - consider virtualization
Re-creating options array on every render causes unnecessary re-renders - use computed or ref
Checkbox group with many options should use key prop for efficient updates
accessibilityNotes: Each checkbox automatically gets proper ARIA attributes
Ensure labels are descriptive and clear for screen readers
Required checkboxes should be marked visually (e.g., with asterisk)
Group related checkboxes with fieldset and legend for better context

examples.title: Basic V1 Date Range Picker
examples.description: Simple date range picker without custom ranges
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePicker
    id="date-picker"
    label="Select Period"
    :value="dateValue"
    :min-date="minDate"
    :max-date="maxDate"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :additional-ranges="true"
    open-position="right"
    @update="handleUpdate" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePicker } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePicker },
  
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01/12/2024',
      endDate: '20/12/2024',
      minDate: '01/01/2023',
      maxDate: new Date().toLocaleDateString('en-US'),
      locale: 'en-US',
      formatMapping: {
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'default': 'mm/dd/yyyy'
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      // V1: Plain object (NOT array)
      return {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleUpdate(rangeStr) {
      // V1 always returns string: "mm/dd/yyyy-mm/dd/yyyy"
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = start;
      this.endDate = end;
      
      console.log('Date range selected:', { start, end });
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: With Custom Ranges & Disabled Dates
examples.description: V1 date picker with custom quick ranges and disabled date range
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePicker
    id="date-picker-custom"
    label="Reporting Period"
    :value="dateValue"
    :custom-date-range="true"
    :custom-ranges="customRanges"
    :disabled-range="disabledRange"
    :additional-ranges="true"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    open-position="center"
    @update="handleUpdate" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePicker } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePicker },
  
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '10/01/2024',
      endDate: '12/31/2024',
      locale: 'en-US',
      formatMapping: {
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'default': 'mm/dd/yyyy'
      },
      // V1 custom ranges: Object with Date arrays
      customRanges: {
        'Q4 2024': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')],
        'Q3 2024': [new Date('2024-07-01'), new Date('2024-09-30')],
        'H2 2024': [new Date('2024-07-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')],
        'Full Year': [new Date('2024-01-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')]
      },
      // V1 disabled range: Unix timestamps in SECONDS
      disabledRange: [
        Math.floor(new Date('2024-12-25').getTime() / 1000), // Christmas
        Math.floor(new Date('2024-12-26').getTime() / 1000)
      ]
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      return {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleUpdate(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = start;
      this.endDate = end;
      
      // Update analytics or fetch data
      this.fetchReportData(start, end);
    },
    
    fetchReportData(startDate, endDate) {
      console.log('Fetching data for:', startDate, 'to', endDate);
      // API call here
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Turkish Locale with Dot Format
examples.description: V1 date picker configured for Turkish locale with dd.mm.yyyy format
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePicker
    id="date-picker-tr"
    label="Tarih Aral Sein"
    :value="dateValue"
    :locale="'tr-TR'"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :additional-ranges="true"
    :custom-date-range="true"
    :custom-ranges="customRanges"
    separator=" - "
    @update="handleUpdate" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePicker } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePicker },
  
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01.12.2024',
      endDate: '31.12.2024',
      formatMapping: {
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'default': 'dd.mm.yyyy'
      },
      customRanges: {
        'Son eyrek': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')],
        'Bu Yl': [new Date('2024-01-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')]
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      return {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleUpdate(rangeStr) {
      // Note: rangeStr is still in mm/dd/yyyy format from component
      // Need to convert to dd.mm.yyyy for Turkish display
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = this.convertToTurkishFormat(start);
      this.endDate = this.convertToTurkishFormat(end);
    },
    
    convertToTurkishFormat(usDateStr) {
      // Convert mm/dd/yyyy to dd.mm.yyyy
      const [month, day, year] = usDateStr.split('/');
      return `${day}.${month}.${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>

valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: V1 uses plain object, NOT array like V2. Date format depends on locale setting. Use mm/dd/yyyy for US locale, dd.mm.yyyy for EU/TR locales.

migrationToV2.notes: V2 requires array to support comparison mode

InDatePickerV2.name: InDatePickerV2
InDatePickerV2.title: In Date Picker

metadata.description: Advanced date picker with single date, date range, and comparison modes. Features quick range selection, custom ranges, date constraints, and multi-locale support.

accessibility.notes: Supports keyboard navigation (Tab, Enter, Arrow keys), proper label association, state announcements, and focus management. Calendar navigation is fully keyboard accessible.

performance.notes: Complex calendar rendering with dual calendars in comparison mode. Uses masked input for date entry. Optimized with v-show for calendar visibility. Consider lazy loading for applications not requiring date selection on initial load.

modes.dateRange: Select a start and end date range
modes.comparison: Select two date ranges for comparison (e.g., current period vs previous period)

features.quickRanges: Pre-defined quick selection buttons (Today, Yesterday, Last Week, etc.)
features.customRanges: Add custom date ranges to quick selection
features.dateConstraints: Min/max date restrictions with disabled date ranges
features.comparison: Compare two date periods with automatic previous period calculation
features.localization: Support for multiple date formats (US, UK, Turkish, etc.)
features.timezone: Timezone offset support for international applications
features.validation: Real-time date validation with custom error messages
features.specialDates: Highlight specific dates with custom colors and labels

useCases: Analytics dashboards with date range selection

examples.title: Basic Date Range Picker
examples.description: Simple date range picker without comparison
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    id="date-picker"
    name="date-picker"
    theme="white"
    label-text="Select Period"
    :value="dateValue"
    :min-date="minDate"
    :max-date="maxDate"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :quick-range-selection-status="true"
    @apply="handleApply" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePickerV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePickerV2 },
  
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01.12.2024',
      endDate: '20.12.2024',
      minDate: '01.01.2023',
      maxDate: new Date(),
      locale: 'tr-TR',
      formatMapping: {
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'default': 'dd.mm.yyyy'
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      return [{
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      }];
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleApply(payload) {
      // payload is string: "mm/dd/yyyy-mm/dd/yyyy"
      const [start, end] = payload.split('-');
      this.startDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(start);
      this.endDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(end);
    },
    
    convertToLocalFormat(dateStr) {
      // Convert mm/dd/yyyy to dd.mm.yyyy for Turkish locale
      const [month, day, year] = dateStr.split('/');
      return `${day}.${month}.${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: With Comparison & Dynamic Ranges
examples.description: Full-featured date picker with comparison mode and dynamically calculated comparison ranges
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    :key="`${datePickerKey}-${startDate}-${endDate}`"
    id="date-picker-compare"
    name="date-picker-compare"
    theme="white"
    label-text="Select Period"
    :value="datePickerValue"
    :min-date="minDate"
    :max-date="maxDate"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :comparison-status="true"
    :disabled-comparison-status="compareDisabled"
    :quick-range-selection-status="true"
    :custom-ranges="customRangesForV2"
    :compared-custom-ranges="comparedCustomRangesForV2"
    @apply="handleApply"
    @periodSelected="handlePeriodSelected"
    @openComparison="handleOpenComparison"
    @closeComparison="handleCloseComparison" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePickerV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePickerV2 },
  
  data() {
    return {
      datePickerKey: 0,
      startDate: '01.12.2024',
      endDate: '20.12.2024',
      comparisonStartDate: '',
      comparisonEndDate: '',
      isComparisonActive: false,
      compareDisabled: false,
      comparedCustomRangesForV2: [],
      minDate: '01.01.2023',
      maxDate: new Date(),
      locale: 'tr-TR',
      formatMapping: {
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'default': 'dd.mm.yyyy'
      },
      customDateRanges: {
        'Q4 2024': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')],
        'Last Quarter': [new Date('2024-07-01'), new Date('2024-09-30')]
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    datePickerValue() {
      const main = {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
      
      if (this.isComparisonActive && this.comparisonStartDate && this.comparisonEndDate) {
        return [
          main,
          {
            startDate: this.comparisonStartDate,
            endDate: this.comparisonEndDate
          }
        ];
      }
      
      return [main];
    },
    
    customRangesForV2() {
      return Object.entries(this.customDateRanges).map(([title, dates], index) => ({
        name: `custom${index + 1}`,
        title,
        startDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[0]),
        endDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[1])
      }));
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handlePeriodSelected(range) {
      // Recalculate dynamic comparison ranges
      const start = this.parseDate(range.start);
      const end = this.parseDate(range.end);
      const periodLength = Math.floor((end - start) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)) + 1;
      
      // Previous Period
      const prevEnd = new Date(start);
      prevEnd.setDate(start.getDate() - 1);
      const prevStart = new Date(prevEnd);
      prevStart.setDate(prevEnd.getDate() - periodLength + 1);
      
      // Previous Period Last Year
      const lastYearStart = new Date(prevStart);
      lastYearStart.setFullYear(prevStart.getFullYear() - 1);
      const lastYearEnd = new Date(prevEnd);
      lastYearEnd.setFullYear(prevEnd.getFullYear() - 1);
      
      this.comparedCustomRangesForV2 = [{
        name: 'lastYear',
        title: 'Previous Period Last Year',
        startDate: this.formatDateToSlash(lastYearStart),
        endDate: this.formatDateToSlash(lastYearEnd)
      }];
    },
    
    handleApply(payload) {
      if (Array.isArray(payload)) {
        // With comparison
        const [mainRange, comparisonRange] = payload;
        this.applyDateRange(mainRange);
        this.applyComparisonRange(comparisonRange);
      } else {
        // Single range
        this.applyDateRange(payload);
      }
    },
    
    applyDateRange(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(start);
      this.endDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(end);
    },
    
    applyComparisonRange(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.comparisonStartDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(start);
      this.comparisonEndDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(end);
    },
    
    handleOpenComparison() {
      this.isComparisonActive = true;
    },
    
    handleCloseComparison() {
      this.isComparisonActive = false;
      this.comparisonStartDate = '';
      this.comparisonEndDate = '';
    },
    
    formatDateToSlash(date) {
      const d = new Date(date);
      const month = String(d.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
      const day = String(d.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
      const year = d.getFullYear();
      return `${month}/${day}/${year}`;
    },
    
    parseDate(dateStr) {
      const parts = dateStr.split(/[/.]/); 
      const isSlash = dateStr.includes('/');
      
      if (isSlash) {
        // mm/dd/yyyy
        const [month, day, year] = parts;
        return new Date(parseInt(year), parseInt(month) - 1, parseInt(day));
      } else {
        // dd.mm.yyyy
        const [day, month, year] = parts;
        return new Date(parseInt(year), parseInt(month) - 1, parseInt(day));
      }
    },
    
    convertToLocalFormat(dateStr) {
      const [month, day, year] = dateStr.split('/');
      return `${day}.${month}.${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>

metadata.description: Dropdown menu component for navigation and actions

InDropdownMenu.typeDefs:
import { DefineComponent } from 'vue';

/**
 * Menu option structure for dropdown items.
 */
export interface MenuOption {
  /**
   * Display text for the menu item.
   */
  text: string;

  /**
   * Unique value for the menu item.
   * Returned in select event when item is clicked.
   */
  value: string | number;

  /**
   * Optional icon name to display with the menu item.
   * Icon names should match InIcons component icon set.
   *
   * @example icon="user"
   * @example icon="settings"
   */
  icon?: string;

  /**
   * Nested submenu items.
   * Creates a hierarchical menu structure.
   *
   * @example
   * children: [
   *   { text: 'Export as PDF', value: 'pdf' },
   *   { text: 'Export as CSV', value: 'csv' }
   * ]
   */
  children?: MenuOption[];

  /**
   * Whether this menu item is disabled.
   * Disabled items are visible but not clickable.
   *
   * @default false
   */
  disabled?: boolean;

  /**
   * Whether this menu item is a divider (separator line).
   * When true, renders a horizontal line instead of a menu item.
   *
   * @default false
   */
  divider?: boolean;
}

/**
 * InDropdownMenu component props.
 */
export interface InDropdownMenuProps {
  /**
   * Unique identifier for the dropdown menu element.
   *
   * @required
   * @example id="user-menu"
   * @example id="actions-dropdown"
   */
  id: string;

  /**
   * Array of menu items to display.
   * Supports nested items via children property.
   *
   * @required
   * @example
   * :options="[
   *   { text: 'Profile', value: 'profile', icon: 'user' },
   *   { text: 'Settings', value: 'settings', icon: 'settings' },
   *   { text: 'Logout', value: 'logout', icon: 'logout' }
   * ]"
   *
   * @example
   * // With nested submenu
   * :options="[
   *   { text: 'New', value: 'new', icon: 'plus' },
   *   {
   *     text: 'Export',
   *     value: 'export',
   *     icon: 'download',
   *     children: [
   *       { text: 'PDF', value: 'export-pdf' },
   *       { text: 'CSV', value: 'export-csv' }
   *     ]
   *   }
   * ]"
   */
  options: MenuOption[];

  /**
   * Controls the open/close state of the dropdown.
   * Use to programmatically show or hide the menu.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :status="isMenuOpen"
   * @example :status="showDropdown"
   */
  status?: boolean;

  /**
   * Enables search/filter functionality in the dropdown.
   * Shows a search input at the top of the menu.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :search-status="true"
   */
  searchStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Shows loading indicator in the dropdown.
   * Useful for async data loading scenarios.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :loading-state="isFetchingOptions"
   */
  loadingState?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Event handler types for InDropdownMenu.
 */
export interface InDropdownMenuEventHandlers {
  /**
   * Handler for select event when menu item is clicked.
   * Receives the value of the selected menu item.
   *
   * @param value - The value of the selected menu item
   * @example
   * const handleSelect = (value: string | number) => {
   *   console.log('Selected:', value);
   *   if (value === 'logout') {
   *     performLogout();
   *   }
   * }
   */
  onSelect?: (value: string | number) => void;

  /**
   * Handler for search event when search input changes.
   * Only emitted when searchStatus is true.
   *
   * @param query - Search query string
   * @example
   * const handleSearch = (query: string) => {
   *   filteredOptions.value = options.filter(opt =>
   *     opt.text.toLowerCase().includes(query.toLowerCase())
   *   );
   * }
   */
  onSearch?: (query: string) => void;
}

/**
 * InDropdownMenu Component
 *
 * Flexible dropdown menu component with nested submenus, icons,
 * search functionality, and keyboard navigation.
 *
 * @example
 * // Basic dropdown menu
 * <InDropdownMenu
 *   id="actions"
 *   :options="[
 *     { text: 'Edit', value: 'edit', icon: 'edit' },
 *     { text: 'Delete', value: 'delete', icon: 'trash' }
 *   ]"
 *   :status="menuOpen"
 *   @select="handleAction"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // User profile menu
 * <template>
 *   <button @click="toggleMenu">
 *     {{ userName }}
 *   </button>
 *
 *   <InDropdownMenu
 *     id="profile-menu"
 *     :options="profileOptions"
 *     :status="menuOpen"
 *     @select="handleMenuAction"
 *   />
 * </template>
 *
 * <script setup>
 * import { ref } from 'vue';
 *
 * const menuOpen = ref(false);
 * const profileOptions = [
 *   { text: 'Profile', value: 'profile', icon: 'user' },
 *   { text: 'Settings', value: 'settings', icon: 'settings' },
 *   { divider: true },
 *   { text: 'Logout', value: 'logout', icon: 'logout' }
 * ];
 *
 * const toggleMenu = () => {
 *   menuOpen.value = !menuOpen.value;
 * };
 * </script>
 *
 * @example
 * // Nested submenu
 * <InDropdownMenu
 *   id="file-menu"
 *   :options="[
 *     { text: 'New', value: 'new', icon: 'plus' },
 *     {
 *       text: 'Export',
 *       value: 'export',
 *       icon: 'download',
 *       children: [
 *         { text: 'Export as PDF', value: 'export-pdf' },
 *         { text: 'Export as CSV', value: 'export-csv' },
 *         { text: 'Export as JSON', value: 'export-json' }
 *       ]
 *     },
 *     { text: 'Print', value: 'print', icon: 'printer' }
 *   ]"
 *   :status="fileMenuOpen"
 *   @select="handleFileAction"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With search functionality
 * <InDropdownMenu
 *   id="searchable-menu"
 *   :options="users"
 *   :status="isOpen"
 *   :search-status="true"
 *   @select="selectUser"
 *   @search="filterUsers"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With loading state
 * <InDropdownMenu
 *   id="async-menu"
 *   :options="menuItems"
 *   :status="isOpen"
 *   :loading-state="isLoading"
 *   @select="handleSelect"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // TypeScript usage
 * import type { InDropdownMenuEventHandlers, MenuOption } from './InDropdownMenu';
 *
 * const options: MenuOption[] = [
 *   { text: 'Option 1', value: 'opt1', icon: 'check' },
 *   { text: 'Option 2', value: 'opt2', disabled: true }
 * ];
 *
 * const handlers: InDropdownMenuEventHandlers = {
 *   onSelect: (value) => console.log('Selected:', value),
 *   onSearch: (query) => console.log('Searching:', query)
 * };
 */
declare const InDropdownMenu: DefineComponent<InDropdownMenuProps>;

export default InDropdownMenu;

InRichTextInput.typeDefs:
import { DefineComponent } from 'vue'; /** * Available toolbar button options for the rich text editor. */ export type ToolbarButton = | 'bold' | 'italic' | 'underline' | 'strike' | 'heading1' | 'heading2' | 'heading3' | 'bulletList' | 'orderedList' | 'alignLeft' | 'alignCenter' | 'alignRight' | 'alignJustify' | 'link' | 'image' | 'blockquote' | 'codeBlock' | 'undo' | 'redo' | 'clear'; /** * InRichTextInput component props. */ export interface InRichTextInputProps { /** * Unique identifier for the editor element. * Required for proper editor initialization and lifecycle. * * @required * @example id="content-editor" * @example id="blog-post-editor" */ id: string; /** * HTML content of the editor. * Use with v-model for two-way binding. * * @required * @example value="

Initial content

" * @example :value="articleContent" */ value: string; /** * Placeholder text shown when editor is empty. * * @default '' * @example placeholder="Start typing..." * @example placeholder="Write your blog post here..." */ placeholder?: string; /** * Disables the editor, preventing user interaction. * Editor content becomes read-only. * * @default false * @example :disabled="isReadOnly" * @example :disabled="!canEdit" */ disabled?: boolean; /** * Array of toolbar button names to display. * When not provided, all toolbar buttons are shown. * Order of buttons follows the array order. * * @default All buttons * @example * :toolbar="['bold', 'italic', 'underline']" * * @example * // Minimal toolbar for comments * :toolbar="['bold', 'italic', 'link']" * * @example * // Full-featured blog editor * :toolbar="[ * 'bold', 'italic', 'underline', 'strike', * 'heading1', 'heading2', 'heading3', * 'bulletList', 'orderedList', * 'alignLeft', 'alignCenter', 'alignRight', * 'link', 'image', 'blockquote', 'codeBlock', * 'undo', 'redo', 'clear' * ]" */ toolbar?: ToolbarButton[]; } /** * Event handler types for InRichTextInput. */ export interface InRichTextInputEventHandlers { /** * Handler for input event (content changes). * Emitted on every content modification. * * @param html - Updated HTML content * @example * const handleInput = (html: string) => { * content.value = html; * console.log('Content updated:', html); * } */ onInput?: (html: string) => void; /** * Handler for change event (on blur). * Emitted when editor loses focus with updated content. * * @param html - Final HTML content * @example * const handleChange = (html: string) => { * saveContent(html); * } */ onChange?: (html: string) => void; } /** * InRichTextInput Component * * WYSIWYG rich text editor component with customizable toolbar, * text formatting, lists, links, images, and HTML output. * * @example * // Basic usage * * * @example * // Custom toolbar for blog posts * * * @example * // Minimal toolbar for comments * * * @example * // Email composer * * * * * @example * // Read-only preview mode * * * @example * // TypeScript usage * import type { InRichTextInputEventHandlers } from './InRichTextInput'; * * const handlers: InRichTextInputEventHandlers = { * onInput: (html) => console.log('Content:', html), * onChange: (html) => saveToServer(html) * }; */ declare const InRichTextInput: DefineComponent; export default InRichTextInput;

examples.title: With Search and Icons
examples.code:
<template>
  <InSelect
    id="country-select"
    label-text="Country"
    placeholder-text="Search countries..."
    :search-status="true"
    :options="countryOptions"
    :value="selectedCountry"
    @optionClick="handleSelect"
    @search="handleSearch" />
</template>

<script>
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InSelect },
  data() {
    return {
      allCountries: [
        { text: 'United States', value: 'US', icon: 'flag-us' },
        { text: 'United Kingdom', value: 'UK', icon: 'flag-uk' },
        { text: 'Turkey', value: 'TR', icon: 'flag-tr' },
        // ... more countries
      ],
      countryOptions: [],
      selectedCountry: []
    };
  },
  created() {
    this.countryOptions = this.allCountries;
  },
  methods: {
    handleSelect(option) {
      this.selectedCountry = [option];
    },
    handleSearch(query) {
      if (!query) {
        this.countryOptions = this.allCountries;
        return;
      }
      this.countryOptions = this.allCountries.filter(country =>
        country.text.toLowerCase().includes(query.toLowerCase())
      );
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Lazy Loading with Infinite Scroll
examples.description: Load options on scroll for large datasets
examples.code:
<template>
  <InSelect
    id="user-select"
    label-text="Select User"
    :search-status="true"
    :lazy-load="true"
    :lazy-load-search="true"
    :fetch-page="currentPage"
    :options="users"
    :value="selectedUser"
    :loading-state="isLoading"
    @optionClick="handleSelect"
    @search="handleSearch"
    @endScroll="loadMore" />
</template>

<script>
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InSelect },
  data() {
    return {
      users: [],
      selectedUser: [],
      currentPage: 1,
      isLoading: false,
      searchQuery: ''
    };
  },
  created() {
    this.loadUsers();
  },
  methods: {
    async loadUsers() {
      this.isLoading = true;
      try {
        const response = await fetch(
          `/api/users?page=${this.currentPage}&search=${this.searchQuery}`
        );
        const data = await response.json();
        
        // Transform API response to select format
        const newUsers = data.users.map(u => ({
          text: u.name,
          value: u.id,
          description: u.email
        }));
        
        this.users = [...this.users, ...newUsers];
      } finally {
        this.isLoading = false;
      }
    },
    
    loadMore() {
      this.currentPage++;
      this.loadUsers();
    },
    
    handleSearch(query) {
      this.searchQuery = query;
      this.currentPage = 1;
      this.users = []; // Clear existing
      this.loadUsers();
    },
    
    handleSelect(option) {
      this.selectedUser = [option];
    }
  }
};
</script>

InSidebarV2.name: InSidebarV2
InSidebarV2.title: In Sidebar

metadata.description: Sidebar navigation component with collapsible items

InSidebarV2.typeDefs:
import { DefineComponent } from 'vue';

/**
 * Sidebar navigation item structure.
 */
export interface SidebarItem {
  /**
   * Unique identifier for the sidebar item.
   * Used for navigation and event handling.
   */
  id: string;

  /**
   * Display label for the sidebar item.
   */
  label: string;

  /**
   * Optional icon name to display with the item.
   * Icon names should match InIcons component icon set.
   *
   * @example icon="home"
   * @example icon="users"
   * @example icon="settings"
   */
  icon?: string;

  /**
   * Whether this item is currently active/selected.
   * Active items are highlighted.
   *
   * @default false
   */
  active?: boolean;

  /**
   * Nested child items for hierarchical navigation.
   * Creates expandable/collapsible sub-sections.
   *
   * @example
   * children: [
   *   { id: 'all-users', label: 'All Users' },
   *   { id: 'add-user', label: 'Add User' }
   * ]
   */
  children?: SidebarItem[];

  /**
   * Whether this item is disabled.
   * Disabled items are visible but not clickable.
   *
   * @default false
   */
  disabled?: boolean;

  /**
   * Badge count to display on the item.
   * Useful for showing notification counts or item counts.
   *
   * @example badge="5"
   * @example :badge="unreadCount"
   */
  badge?: string | number;

  /**
   * Custom CSS class to apply to this item.
   *
   * @example customClass="danger"
   * @example customClass="highlighted"
   */
  customClass?: string;
}

/**
 * InSidebarV2 component props.
 */
export interface InSidebarV2Props {
  /**
   * Unique identifier for the sidebar element.
   *
   * @required
   * @example id="main-sidebar"
   * @example id="admin-nav"
   */
  id: string;

  /**
   * Array of navigation items to display.
   * Supports nested items via children property.
   *
   * @required
   * @example
   * :items="[
   *   { id: 'dashboard', label: 'Dashboard', icon: 'home', active: true },
   *   { id: 'users', label: 'Users', icon: 'users' },
   *   { id: 'settings', label: 'Settings', icon: 'settings' }
   * ]"
   *
   * @example
   * // With nested items
   * :items="[
   *   { id: 'dashboard', label: 'Dashboard', icon: 'home' },
   *   {
   *     id: 'users',
   *     label: 'Users',
   *     icon: 'users',
   *     children: [
   *       { id: 'all-users', label: 'All Users' },
   *       { id: 'add-user', label: 'Add User' }
   *     ]
   *   }
   * ]"
   */
  items: SidebarItem[];

  /**
   * Controls the collapsed state of the sidebar.
   * When true, shows only icons; labels are hidden.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :collapsed="isSidebarCollapsed"
   */
  collapsed?: boolean;

  /**
   * Width of the sidebar in pixels.
   * Only applies when sidebar is not collapsed.
   *
   * @default 240
   * @example :width="280"
   * @example :width="320"
   */
  width?: number;

  /**
   * Background color theme for the sidebar.
   *
   * @default 'dark'
   * @example theme="dark"
   * @example theme="light"
   */
  theme?: 'dark' | 'light';

  /**
   * Whether to show tooltips for items when collapsed.
   * Helpful for showing full labels when only icons are visible.
   *
   * @default true
   * @example :show-tooltips="true"
   */
  showTooltips?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Event handler types for InSidebarV2.
 */
export interface InSidebarV2EventHandlers {
  /**
   * Handler for item click event.
   * Emitted when a sidebar item is clicked.
   *
   * @param itemId - The id of the clicked item
   * @example
   * const handleItemClick = (itemId: string) => {
   *   console.log('Navigate to:', itemId);
   *   router.push({ name: itemId });
   * }
   */
  onItemClick?: (itemId: string) => void;

  /**
   * Handler for toggle event.
   * Emitted when sidebar collapse state changes.
   *
   * @param collapsed - New collapsed state
   * @example
   * const handleToggle = (collapsed: boolean) => {
   *   isSidebarCollapsed.value = collapsed;
   * }
   */
  onToggle?: (collapsed: boolean) => void;

  /**
   * Handler for expand/collapse of nested items.
   * Emitted when a parent item with children is clicked.
   *
   * @param itemId - The id of the parent item
   * @param expanded - Whether the item is now expanded
   * @example
   * const handleExpand = (itemId: string, expanded: boolean) => {
   *   console.log(`Item ${itemId} is ${expanded ? 'expanded' : 'collapsed'}`);
   * }
   */
  onExpand?: (itemId: string, expanded: boolean) => void;
}

/**
 * InSidebarV2 Component
 *
 * Responsive sidebar navigation component with collapsible sections,
 * nested items, icons, active state management, and smooth animations.
 *
 * @example
 * // Basic sidebar
 * <InSidebarV2
 *   id="nav"
 *   :items="[
 *     { id: 'home', label: 'Home', icon: 'home', active: true },
 *     { id: 'about', label: 'About', icon: 'info' },
 *     { id: 'contact', label: 'Contact', icon: 'mail' }
 *   ]"
 *   @item-click="navigate"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // Collapsible sidebar
 * <template>
 *   <InSidebarV2
 *     id="main-sidebar"
 *     :items="navItems"
 *     :collapsed="isCollapsed"
 *     :width="280"
 *     @item-click="handleNavigation"
 *     @toggle="isCollapsed = $event"
 *   />
 *
 *   <button @click="isCollapsed = !isCollapsed">
 *     Toggle Sidebar
 *   </button>
 * </template>
 *
 * @example
 * // With nested navigation
 * <InSidebarV2
 *   id="admin-nav"
 *   :items="[
 *     { id: 'dashboard', label: 'Dashboard', icon: 'home' },
 *     {
 *       id: 'users',
 *       label: 'Users',
 *       icon: 'users',
 *       children: [
 *         { id: 'all-users', label: 'All Users' },
 *         { id: 'add-user', label: 'Add User' },
 *         { id: 'roles', label: 'Roles' }
 *       ]
 *     },
 *     {
 *       id: 'content',
 *       label: 'Content',
 *       icon: 'file-text',
 *       children: [
 *         { id: 'posts', label: 'Posts' },
 *         { id: 'pages', label: 'Pages' }
 *       ]
 *     }
 *   ]"
 *   @item-click="navigateTo"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With badges and active state
 * <template>
 *   <InSidebarV2
 *     id="nav"
 *     :items="navWithBadges"
 *     @item-click="setActive"
 *   />
 * </template>
 *
 * <script setup>
 * import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
 *
 * const activeItemId = ref('dashboard');
 * const unreadMessages = ref(5);
 *
 * const navWithBadges = computed(() => [
 *   {
 *     id: 'dashboard',
 *     label: 'Dashboard',
 *     icon: 'home',
 *     active: activeItemId.value === 'dashboard'
 *   },
 *   {
 *     id: 'messages',
 *     label: 'Messages',
 *     icon: 'mail',
 *     badge: unreadMessages.value,
 *     active: activeItemId.value === 'messages'
 *   }
 * ]);
 *
 * const setActive = (itemId) => {
 *   activeItemId.value = itemId;
 *   router.push({ name: itemId });
 * };
 * </script>
 *
 * @example
 * // TypeScript usage
 * import type { InSidebarV2EventHandlers, SidebarItem } from './InSidebarV2';
 *
 * const items: SidebarItem[] = [
 *   { id: 'home', label: 'Home', icon: 'home', active: true },
 *   { id: 'settings', label: 'Settings', icon: 'settings', badge: '3' }
 * ];
 *
 * const handlers: InSidebarV2EventHandlers = {
 *   onItemClick: (itemId) => console.log('Clicked:', itemId),
 *   onToggle: (collapsed) => console.log('Collapsed:', collapsed)
 * };
 * </script>
 */
declare const InSidebarV2: DefineComponent<InSidebarV2Props>;

export default InSidebarV2;

examples.title: Complete Sidebar with Navigation
examples.description: Full example with routes, search, and navigation
examples.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { useRouter, useRoute } from 'vue-router';
import { InSidebarV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const router = useRouter();
const route = useRoute();

const unreadCount = ref(5);
const navigationRoutes = computed(() => [
  { 
    id: 'dashboard', 
    label: 'Dashboard', 
    path: '/', 
    icon: 'home',
    active: route.path === '/'
  },
  { 
    id: 'inbox', 
    label: 'Inbox', 
    path: '/inbox', 
    icon: 'mail',
    badge: unreadCount.value,
    active: route.path === '/inbox'
  },
  {
    id: 'admin',
    label: 'Administration',
    path: '/admin',
    icon: 'lock',
    children: [
      { id: 'users', label: 'Users', path: '/admin/users' },
      { id: 'settings', label: 'Settings', path: '/admin/settings' }
    ]
  }
]);

const handleNavigate = (routeObj) => {
  router.push(routeObj.path);
};
</script>

<template>
  <InSidebarV2 
    :routes="navigationRoutes"
    @navigate="handleNavigate"
  />
</template>

examples.title: Sidebar with Search Functionality
examples.description: Sidebar with debounced search and recent searches
examples.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { debounce } from 'lodash-es';

const searchQuery = ref('');
const searchResults = ref([]);
const recentSearches = ref(
  JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('recentSearches') || '[]')
);

const performSearch = async (query) => {
  if (!query) {
    searchResults.value = [];
    return;
  }
  
  // Simulate API call
  const results = await api.search(query);
  searchResults.value = results.slice(0, 10);
  
  // Add to recent searches
  const updated = [query, ...recentSearches.value.filter(s => s !== query)].slice(0, 10);
  recentSearches.value = updated;
  localStorage.setItem('recentSearches', JSON.stringify(updated));
};

const debouncedSearch = debounce(performSearch, 300);

const handleSearch = (query) => {
  searchQuery.value = query;
  debouncedSearch(query);
};

const handleSearchResultClick = (result) => {
  router.push(result.path);
};
</script>

<template>
  <InSidebarV2 
    :routes="routes"
    :search-results="searchResults"
    :recent-searches="recentSearches"
    @search="handleSearch"
    @search-result-click="handleSearchResultClick"
  />
</template>

InTooltipV2.name: InTooltipV2
InTooltipV2.title: In Tooltip
InTooltipV2.typeDefs: import { DefineComponent } from 'vue'; /** * Static position options for tooltip placement. */ export type TooltipStaticPosition = | 'top center' | 'top left' | 'top right' | 'bottom center' | 'bottom left' | 'bottom right' | 'right center' | 'right top' | 'right bottom' | 'left center' | 'left top' | 'left bottom'; /** * Triangle position for the tooltip pointer. */ export type TrianglePosition = 'top' | 'bottom'; /** * Triangle alignment relative to tooltip edge. */ export type TriangleAlignment = 'start' | 'center' | 'end'; /** * Tooltip alignment options. */ export type TooltipAlignment = 'start' | 'center' | 'end' | false; /** * Position offset configuration. */ export interface PositionOffset { /** * Horizontal offset in pixels. */ x: number; /** * Vertical offset in pixels. */ y: number; } /** * Absolute position configuration. */ export interface AbsolutePosition { /** * Top position in pixels or CSS value. */ top?: string | number; /** * Right position in pixels or CSS value. */ right?: string | number; /** * Bottom position in pixels or CSS value. */ bottom?: string | number; /** * Left position in pixels or CSS value. */ left?: string | number; } /** * InTooltipV2 component props. */ export interface InTooltipV2Props { /** * Unique identifier for the tooltip element. * Required for proper tooltip positioning and lifecycle management. * * @required * @example id="help-tooltip" * @example id="field-description-tooltip" */ id: string; /** * Tooltip content text. * Supports HTML content when preventXss is false. * * @required * @example text="This is helpful information" * @example text="Important: Read this carefully" */ text: string; /** * Enables smart dynamic positioning based on viewport. * Automatically adjusts tooltip position to stay visible. * * @default true * @example :dynamic-position="true" */ dynamicPosition?: boolean; /** * Fixed position when dynamicPosition is false. * Determines where tooltip appears relative to trigger. * * @default 'top center' * @example static-position="bottom left" * @example static-position="right center" */ staticPosition?: TooltipStaticPosition; /** * Shows default tooltip icon as trigger element. * When false, use triggerElement slot for custom trigger. * * @default false * @example :icon-status="true" */ iconStatus?: boolean; /** * Position offset from trigger element in pixels. * * @default { x: 4, y: 4 } * @example :offset="{ x: 10, y: 15 }" */ offset?: PositionOffset; /** * Sanitizes HTML content to prevent XSS attacks. * Enable for user-generated content. * * @default false * @example :prevent-xss="true" */ preventXss?: boolean; /** * Maximum height of tooltip content in pixels. * Content becomes scrollable if exceeded. * * @default 320 * @example :max-height="200" */ maxHeight?: number; /** * Controls tooltip visibility. * Use to programmatically show/hide tooltip. * * @default true * @example :status="showTooltip" */ status?: boolean; /** * Forces tooltip alignment when dynamic positioning. * Overrides automatic alignment calculation. * * @default false * @example tooltip-alignment="center" * @example tooltip-alignment="start" */ tooltipAlignment?: TooltipAlignment; /** * Enables absolute CSS positioning mode. * Use with absolutePosition prop for manual positioning. * * @default false * @example :absolute-position-status="true" */ absolutePositionStatus?: boolean; /** * CSS position values when absolutePositionStatus is true. * Allows complete manual control over tooltip placement. * * @default {} * @example :absolute-position="{ top: '20px', left: '100px' }" */ absolutePosition?: AbsolutePosition; /** * Triangle alignment when using absolute positioning. * * @default 'center' * @example absolute-triangle-alignment="start" */ absoluteTriangleAlignment?: TriangleAlignment; /** * Triangle position when using absolute positioning. * * @default 'top' * @example absolute-triangle-position="bottom" */ absoluteTrianglePosition?: TrianglePosition; } /** * InTooltipV2 Component * * Advanced tooltip component with smart dynamic positioning, customizable * trigger elements, XSS protection, and flexible content slots. * * @example * // Basic tooltip with icon * * * @example * // With custom trigger element * * * * * @example * // With rich HTML content slot * * * * * * @example * // Static positioning * * * @example * // With XSS protection for user content * * * @example * // Conditional tooltip * * * */ declare const InTooltipV2: DefineComponent; export default InTooltipV2;

<!-- V1 Implementation -->
<template>
  <InDatePicker
    id="date-picker"
    :value="dateValue"
    :custom-ranges="customRanges"
    :disabled-range="disabledRange"
    :additional-ranges="true"
    :visible-range="true"
    open-position="right"
    @update="handleUpdate" />
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01/12/2024',
      endDate: '20/12/2024',
      customRanges: {
        'Q4 2024': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')]
      },
      disabledRange: [1704067200, 1735689599] // Unix timestamps
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      return {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleUpdate(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = start;
      this.endDate = end;
    }
  }
};
</script>
InDatePicker-to-V2.fullExampleAfter:
<!-- V2 Implementation -->
<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    id="date-picker"
    :value="datePickerValue"
    :custom-ranges="customRangesForV2"
    :disabled-range="disabledRangeForV2"
    :default-ranges="['Today', 'Yesterday', 'Last 7 Days', 'Last 30 Days', 'This Month', 'Last Month']"
    :quick-range-selection-status="true"
    calendar-popover-align="right"
    @apply="handleApply" />
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01/12/2024',
      endDate: '20/12/2024',
      customRanges: {
        'Q4 2024': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')]
      },
      disabledRange: [1704067200, 1735689599]
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    datePickerValue() {
      return [{
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      }];
    },
    
    customRangesForV2() {
      return Object.entries(this.customRanges).map(([title, dates], index) => ({
        name: `custom${index + 1}`,
        title,
        startDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[0]),
        endDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[1])
      }));
    },
    
    disabledRangeForV2() {
      if (this.disabledRange && this.disabledRange.length === 2) {
        return {
          startDate: this.formatDate(new Date(this.disabledRange[0] * 1000)),
          endDate: this.formatDate(new Date(this.disabledRange[1] * 1000))
        };
      }
      return { startDate: '', endDate: '' };
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleApply(payload) {
      if (Array.isArray(payload)) {
        const [mainRange, comparisonRange] = payload;
        this.applyMainRange(mainRange);
        this.applyComparisonRange(comparisonRange);
      } else {
        this.applyMainRange(payload);
      }
    },
    
    applyMainRange(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = start;
      this.endDate = end;
    },
    
    applyComparisonRange(rangeStr) {
      // Handle comparison range if needed
    },
    
    formatDateToSlash(date) {
      const d = new Date(date);
      const month = String(d.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
      const day = String(d.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
      const year = d.getFullYear();
      return `${month}/${day}/${year}`;
    },
    
    formatDate(date) {
      const d = new Date(date);
      const day = String(d.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
      const month = String(d.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
      const year = d.getFullYear();
      return `${month}/${day}/${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>
